urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG
@EnvAgencyMids Criminally culpable for grievous bodily harm now take them to court.
@tayz_BETH @joanne_dodd Westlands tonight absolutely stinks. There you go @EnvAgencyMids no need to sniff tonight. Shocking unprofessional set up. Shame on you.
@EnvAgencyMids Not good enough how many chances? Shut it down, jail the directors and throw away the key NOW
@EnvAgencyMids Will they remember to turn it on ? #stopthestink
Great to be working on some exciting nature recovery plans closely with @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySW at Gordano #NNR #SSSI https://t.co/sQueIHdXM8

tweets.text:
üåä St Annes Sea Wall Proposals üåä

We are aiming to submit a feasibility report to the Environment Agency in June 2021, outlining the proposed option for the replacement of the St Annes sea wall.

More info and an opportunity to comment can be found at: https://t.co/JkCWjj5Pvg https://t.co/ObgxoJriDE

@markdjohnson99 @jazzmariner @EnvAgency Informed him I wasn't prepared to move to allow cutting to continue, as there were breeding birds carrying foodstuff into nests in this area of flood bank. He was OK and said he would contact their foreman to redeploy them elsewhere.

üò° People are still taking BBQs to our moorland.

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
Paraphrasing the life of Brian . Other than gas ( in association with red ) , poor mental health of a lot of people , illness and sick children Just what have @EnvAgencyMids given us ? @StinkStopthe

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs
